title: Is this Toxic?

replies.body:
1) Why announce that you're muting them?  Just mute, no need to trumpet it.
^This is legit what's angering them and prompting them to spam ping.

2) Unless trolling through gameplay or something their reports will amount to nothing.

> [{quoted}](name=LostFr0st,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=Ou6OaEfp,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2018-01-04T22:52:29.897+0000)
>
> 1) Why announce that you're muting them?  Just mute, no need to trumpet it.
> ^This is legit what's angering them and prompting them to spam ping.
> 
> 2) Unless trolling through gameplay or something their reports will amount to nothing.

you need to announce it, so they don't communicate you information, that won't be received.

No, really you don't.  Let them chat.
All announcing it does is piss them off and prompt them to bad-mouth/rage about the mute instead of playing the game.

They start using pings after they don't get a reply, assuming the person just isn't reading chat.

> [{quoted}](name=LostFr0st,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=Ou6OaEfp,comment-id=000000000000,timestamp=2018-01-04T23:00:33.996+0000)
>

> All announcing it does is piss them off and prompt them to bad-mouth/rage about the mute instead of playing the game.

it is true, but I doubt they will do this for a long time ( I don't have XP with this). Mbe in start of game and during some unluck.

I've seen it happen before.
They legit scapegoat every bad fight/event without the muting player on that player.
Even if the accusation doesn't make sense/they can blame their own misplay.

This gets illustrated in the post game notably through stuff like OP wrote:

>"Report him he muted us all!"

Telling them about the mute just gives an excuse.

> [{quoted}](name=LostFr0st,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=Ou6OaEfp,comment-id=000000000000,timestamp=2018-01-04T23:00:33.996+0000)
>
> No, really you don't.  Let them chat.
> All announcing it does is piss them off and prompt them to bad-mouth/rage about the mute instead of playing the game.
> 
> They start using pings after they don't get a reply, assuming the person just isn't reading chat.

How about this
you warn them, that misusing/ nonseless usage of pings will cause ping mute as well, thus preventing them from spamming it. If they start spamming just mute for 3-5 mins.
Sometimes info like I will splitpush, make sure to keep an eye on them is hard to be translated into pings, (make up your own example if you wish)  thus player will at least know that this info won't reach you, so he won't attempt to do anything like this or will be warned.

No, just pretend they're kittens.

Just start using the laserpointer (blue ping without a name) and they will too.

People don't tend to remember neutral experiences; they focus on good ones (sometimes) but mostly negative ones (which telling them they're muted falls under).

The info is still helpful to the rest of the team.
Them being muted by one person doesn't change that.

That's an odd question to ask when you've already told others the answer on your other account. 

https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/player-behavior-moderation/uuPx9Ycx-if-you-mute-all-more-than-likely-youll-get-reported?comment=00030000
Sorry friend I don't know you or this other account. Seems your activity is less than reputable anyhow. Thanks for the resource though.
You know yourself, that it is not toxic. Why do you ask, unless you got ban/warning ?

No.



But just mute and not announce it, so people don't cry about it.

People have been punished for ping spam as harassment. Though it is typically a manual review action. 

You can't be punished for "not communicating".
